verses.verse: The preparations<WH4633> of the heart<WH3820> in man<WH120>, and the answer<WH4617> of the tongue<WH3956>, is from the LORD<WH3068>.
All the ways<WH1870> of a man<WH376> are clean<WH2134> in his own eyes<WH5869>; but the LORD<WH3068> weigheth<WH8505> the spirits<WH7307>.
Commit<WH1556> thy works<WH4639> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and thy thoughts<WH4284> shall be established<WH3559>.
The LORD<WH3068> hath made<WH6466> all things for himself<WH4617>: yea, even the wicked<WH7563> for the day<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>.
Every one that is proud<WH1362> in heart<WH3820> is an abomination<WH8441> to the LORD<WH3068>: though hand<WH3027> join in hand<WH3027>, he shall not be unpunished<WH5352>.
By mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> iniquity<WH5771> is purged<WH3722>: and by the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> men depart<WH5493> from evil<WH7451>.
When a man's<WH376> ways<WH1870> please<WH7521> the LORD<WH3068>, he maketh even his enemies<WH341> to be at peace<WH7999> with him.
Better<WH2896> is a little<WH4592> with righteousness<WH6666> than great<WH7230> revenues<WH8393> without right<WH4941>.
A man's<WH120> heart<WH3820> deviseth<WH2803> his way<WH1870>: but the LORD<WH3068> directeth<WH3559> his steps<WH6806>.
A divine sentence<WH7081> is in the lips<WH8193> of the king<WH4428>: his mouth<WH6310> transgresseth<WH4603> not in judgment<WH4941>.
A just<WH4941> weight<WH6425> and balance<WH3976> are the LORD's<WH3068>: all the weights<WH68> of the bag<WH3599> are his work<WH4639>.
It is an abomination<WH8441> to kings<WH4428> to commit<WH6213> wickedness<WH7562>: for the throne<WH3678> is established<WH3559> by righteousness<WH6666>.
Righteous<WH6664> lips<WH8193> are the delight<WH7522> of kings<WH4428>; and they love<WH157> him that speaketh<WH1696> right<WH3477>.
The wrath<WH2534> of a king<WH4428> is as messengers<WH4397> of death<WH4194>: but a wise<WH2450> man<WH376> will pacify<WH3722> it.
In the light<WH216> of the king's<WH4428> countenance<WH6440> is life<WH2416>; and his favour<WH7522> is as a cloud<WH5645> of the latter rain<WH4456>.
How much better<WH2896> is it to get<WH7069> wisdom<WH2451> than gold<WH2742>! and to get<WH7069> understanding<WH998> rather to be chosen<WH977> than silver<WH3701>!
The highway<WH4546> of the upright<WH3477> is to depart<WH5493> from evil<WH7451>: he that keepeth<WH5341> his way<WH1870> preserveth<WH8104> his soul<WH5315>.
Pride<WH1347> goeth before<WH6440> destruction<WH7667>, and an haughty<WH1363> spirit<WH7307> before<WH6440> a fall<WH3783>.
Better<WH2896> it is to be of an humble<WH8217> spirit<WH7307> with the lowly<WH6035><WH6041>, than to divide<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998> with the proud<WH1343>.
He that handleth a matter<WH1697> wisely<WH7919> shall find<WH4672> good<WH2896>: and whoso trusteth<WH982> in the LORD<WH3068>, happy<WH835> is he.
The wise<WH2450> in heart<WH3820> shall be called<WH7121> prudent<WH995>: and the sweetness<WH4986> of the lips<WH8193> increaseth<WH3254> learning<WH3948>.
Understanding<WH7922> is a wellspring<WH4726> of life<WH2416> unto him that hath<WH1167> it: but the instruction<WH4148> of fools<WH191> is folly<WH200>.
The heart<WH3820> of the wise<WH2450> teacheth<WH7919> his mouth<WH6310>, and addeth<WH3254> learning<WH3948> to his lips<WH8193>.
Pleasant<WH5278> words<WH561> are as an honeycomb<WH6688><WH1706>, sweet<WH4966> to the soul<WH5315>, and health<WH4832> to the bones<WH6106>.
There is<WH3426> a way<WH1870> that seemeth right<WH3477> unto<WH6440> a man<WH376>, but the end<WH319> thereof are the ways<WH1870> of death<WH4194>.
He<WH5315> that laboureth<WH6001> laboureth<WH5998> for himself; for his mouth<WH6310> craveth<WH404> it of him.
An ungodly<WH1100> man<WH376> diggeth up<WH3738> evil<WH7451>: and in his lips<WH8193> there is as a burning<WH6867> fire<WH784>.
A froward<WH8419> man<WH376> soweth<WH7971> strife<WH4066>: and a whisperer<WH5372> separateth<WH6504> chief friends<WH441>.
A violent<WH2555> man<WH376> enticeth<WH6601> his neighbour<WH7453>, and leadeth<WH3212> him into the way<WH1870> that is not good<WH2896>.
He shutteth<WH6095> his eyes<WH5869> to devise<WH2803> froward things<WH8419>: moving<WH7169> his lips<WH8193> he bringeth<WH3615> evil<WH7451> to pass<WH3615>.
The hoary head<WH7872> is a crown<WH5850> of glory<WH8597>, if it be found<WH4672> in the way<WH1870> of righteousness<WH6666>.
He that is slow<WH750> to anger<WH639> is better<WH2896> than the mighty<WH1368>; and he that ruleth<WH4910> his spirit<WH7307> than he that taketh<WH3920> a city<WH5892>.
The lot<WH1486> is cast<WH2904> into the lap<WH2436>; but the whole disposing<WH4941> thereof is of the LORD<WH3068>.
